comments:
Ant scripts may be used to execute different kinds of tasks, including java and 
javac. It is very often situation when such task may print stacktrace to the 
output. It will be very convenient to be able to have hyperlink to the source 
code for the classes from this stacktrace.

Below is the stacktrace produced by Weblogic server started from Ant script 
within Eclipse.

        [java] com.ibm.services.transport.TransportServicesException: Cannot 
open a JMS connection due to Exception: javax.jms.JMSException. Details: 
MQJMS2008: failed to open MQ queue

(JMSServices.java:497)

Fixed. Added the java line tracker as a listener to ant processes as well.

NOTE: to get complete stack traces to appear, I used "fork" in my java command.

	<target name="npe" description="Runs the NPE with java">
		<java
			classname="junit.samples.NPE"
			classpath="${project_dir}/bin"
			fork="true">
		</java>
	</target>

traces.message: Cannot  open a JMS connection due to Exception: javax.jms.JMSException. Details:  MQJMS2008: failed to open MQ queue         [java]
